results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: Read this title
results.creator_credit: Tristan Tatenhou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: What if…This entertaining story is told through simple drawings, text and commentary by the narrator who describes chunks of his life in a somewhat cynical but humourous way.

results.title: Sixteen candles
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Hilton Green and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: John Hughes spirited teen comedy stars Molly Ringwald as Samantha Baker, an average teenage girl whose awkward trek through adolescence becomes unbearable when her parents forget her sixteenth birthday. To make matters worse the high school geek (Anthony Michael Hall) starts hitting on her while Samantha negotiates her own painful crush for the handsome but taken senior, Jake Ryan (Michael Schoeffling). Aside from some moments of broad slapstick and crass stereotypes, Hughes makes some pointed observations on the trials, rituals and tribulations of American teenagers and in the process created a teen icon out of his luminous lead Molly Ringwald. “Sixteen candles” was the beginning of a very lucrative career in teen movies for Hughes who cornered the market in the 80’s with such films as “The “Breakfast club”, “Pretty in pink” and “Ferris Buellers day off”. Cast also includes John Cusack, Justin Henry, Paul Dooley, Gedde Watanabe, Jami Gertz and Joan Cusack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hughes, Hilton Green and Universal Pictures

results.title: A Different type of game
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hodges, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The games men play - how cricket and the Aussie male ethos played a major part in Stephen’s adolescent years and on into his adult life. He learnt to play the game and the game never dies.

results.title: Icaros
results.creator_credit: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson
results.brief_description: An adaptation to film of an exercise in dance and music. The animation reveals new aspects of what was an event of true improvisation. A hand drawn dance sequence which revolves around elements of the sun, light, and joy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson

results.title: Six heavy fish and a ton of sinkers
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Historical re-enactments recount the story of the location, recovery and restoration of six cannons jettisoned by Captain James Cook when the “Endeavour” struck a reef off the coast of what is now Queensland. Good use of underwater photography.

results.title: My life to study
results.creator_credit: Fei Hu Song, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Fei Hu Song and his family came from China to Australia, they all took English language courses. This began for Hu Song a lifetime of study and of making Australia his home.

results.title: Harry Bachelor
results.brief_description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?
results.description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?
